    - title: "Registry of Research Data Repositories"
      path: https://www.re3data.org/
      description: >
        **Registry:** Launched in 2012, this comprehensive registry of research data repositories provides embeddable tools and detailed metadata—including data accessibility, licensing, persistent identifiers, and certification information. All metadata is available under a CC0 license and accessible via an API.
      image: https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/f/fe/Re3data_Logo_RGB_72dpi.png
      categories: [ord]
    - title: "SwissUbase"
      path: https://www.swissubase.ch/
      description: >
        **Cross-disciplinary:** SwissUbase is a national solution primarily serving the social sciences and linguistics. Operated by [FORS](https://forscenter.ch/), it was launched in 2021 to replace FORSbase and features its own metadata schema for studies, datasets, and data files with Digital Object Identifier (DOI) support at the dataset level.
      image: https://www.swissubase.ch/swissubase-logo.webp
      categories: [ord]
    - title: "DaSCH Service Platform (DSP)"
      path: https://app.dasch.swiss/
      description: >
            **Humanities:** The DaSCH Service Platform is a national research infrastructure dedicated to preserving long-term humanities data. The DaSCH – Swiss National Data and Service Center for the Humanities was initiated by the University of Basel's Digital Humanities Lab. In 2017, DaSCH was established as a national facility operated by the Swiss Academy of Humanities and Social Sciences (SAGW). Since 2021, it has operated as a national research data infrastructure primarily funded by the Swiss National Science Foundation (SNSF). The platform employs a core ontology (Knora) and provides modern APIs (RESTful JSON-LD and IIIF Image API) along with Archival Resource Keys (ARKs).
      image: https://app.dasch.swiss/assets/images/dasch-mosaic-icon-color.svg
      categories: [iiif, linked data, ord]
    - title: "OLOS"
      path: https://olos.swiss/portal/
      description: >
        **Cross-institutional:** OLOS is a consultation and archive portal developed under the Data Life-Cycle Management (DLCM) project. It serves multiple institutions and utilizes the Datacite Metadata Schema with DOI assignment at the dataset level.
      image: https://www.swissuniversities.ch/fileadmin/swissuniversities/Dokumente/Hochschulpolitik/P-5_Services_Kommunikationsprojekt/OLOS/Logo_OLOS.png
      categories: [ord]
    - title: "Yareta"
      path: https://yareta.unige.ch/
      description: >
        **Institutional:** Yareta is the research data repository developed for Geneva’s higher education institutions. Launched in 2019 and built upon the OLOS platform, it is tailored to manage institutional research data.
      image: https://yareta.unige.ch/assets/themes/yareta/toolbar-header-image.png
      categories: [iiif, linked data, ord]

      path: https://zenodo.org/
      description: >
        **Generic:** Developed at CERN, Zenodo is a generalist repository that allows anyone to deposit data. It supports DOI assignment for each version of deposited data, making it a versatile platform for researchers in any discipline.
      image: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/zenodo/zenodo/master/zenodo/modules/theme/static/img/logos/zenodo-gradient-square.svg

        **National/Registry:** opendata.swiss is the central portal for open government data in Switzerland, managed by the Federal Statistical Office (FSO). Originally launched in 2013 by the Swiss Federal Archives as opendata.admin.ch and rebranded in 2016, it aggregates metadata via a JSON API and an XML file compliant with the DCAT-AP CH standard.
      image: https://www.bfs.admin.ch/dam/bfs/de/logos/campaign/opendata_OFS_portail.png

      path: https://lindas.admin.ch/
      description: >

      image: https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/9/95/Coat_of_arms_of_Switzerland.svg

      path: https://visualize.admin.ch/

## Platforms and Organisations

This page features a curated selection of open data platforms and organisations, with a particular emphasis on Switzerland. You can explore various initiatives—ranging from research data repositories like the [Registry of Research Data Repositories](https://www.re3data.org/), [SwissUbase](https://www.swissubase.ch/), and [DaSCH Service Platform](https://app.dasch.swiss/) to open government data portals such as [opendata.swiss](https://opendata.swiss/), [LINDAS](https://lindas.admin.ch) [Open Data Basel-Stadt](https://data.bs.ch/), [Stadt Zürich Open Data](https://data.stadt-zuerich.ch/), and the [Open Data Portal of Geneva Public Transport](https://opendata.tpg.ch/). In addition, learn more about community-driven organisations like the [Open Knowledge Network](https://okfn.org/), [Open Research Data National Strategy Council](https://openresearchdata.swiss/) [opendata.ch](https://opendata.ch/), and [Open Data Beer](https://opendatabeer.ch/).

For more information about OGD in Switzerland, please see this curated list on GitHub: <https://github.com/rnckp/awesome-ogd-switzerland>.
